Gari () is a type of tsukemono (pickled vegetables). It is sweet, thinly sliced 
young ginger that has been marinated in a solution of sugar and vinegar. Young 
ginger is generally preferred for gari because of its tender flesh and natural 
sweetness. Gari is often served and eaten after sushi, and is sometimes called 
sushi ... It is used to cleanse the palate between eating different pieces of sushi,...
